intro: Draba peasei, commonly known as the Pease's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Draba peasei has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. It is an important component of the alpine flora, contributing to biodiversity in its native habitat.
